title: Senior Software Engineer II, Channels
description: Braze is seeking a Senior Software Engineer to join the Chat Apps team, responsible for building and scaling new chat messaging channels.
The team has launched an existing channel, LINE, which is popular in Japan and other Asian markets, and is currently building a second channel, Kakaotalk, for South Korea.
The role involves building new features, improving performance, and providing guidance on architectural decisions, with a focus on front-end architecture for rich messaging.
The company values collaboration and continuous learning among engineers.
requirements: Candidates must have 5+ years of full-stack development experience, with a strong focus on front-end web development.
Proficiency in modern JavaScript tooling such as React, Vue, or Angular, including experience in writing automated tests, is required.
A strong understanding of distributed systems, data structures, and algorithms is essential.
Candidates should be self-starters with excellent communication and organizational skills.
Prior experience working in a team environment is necessary.
Bonus qualifications include professional experience with Ruby, Rails, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Redis, and Sidekiq, as well as experience with agile processes and building distributed systems at scale.

title: Senior Developer Experience Engineer
description: Virtru is a leading data protection provider focused on changing the rules for data privacy through end-to-end encryption.
The company is seeking a Senior Developer Experience Engineer to join at a pivotal moment in its growth, reporting to the Staff Architect 2.
This role involves being the founding member of the Developer Experience practice, shaping how developers interact with the Data Security Platform and OpenTDF SDKs.

Responsibilities include driving the development of multi-language SDKs, improving the developer onboarding experience, creating technical documentation, engaging with the open-source community, measuring developer experience metrics, advocating for developers, and establishing processes and standards for the Developer Experience practice.
requirements: Candidates should have 5-7 years of software engineering experience focused on developer-facing tools, SDKs, or APIs.
Hands-on experience in building and maintaining SDKs, developer tools, or APIs in production environments is required.
Strong programming skills in Go, Java, and/or JavaScript with the ability to write idiomatic code in each language are necessary.
Familiarity with API design principles and best practices for developer-facing interfaces is essential.
A background in Developer Experience or Developer Relations with a track record of improving developer adoption and satisfaction is preferred.
Experience in community engagement, particularly with open-source projects, is important.
Candidates should possess technical writing skills to create clear documentation, blogs, and tutorials.
Strategic thinking combined with hands-on execution is required, along with exceptional communication skills for collaboration.
A self-starter mentality with the ability to build from scratch with minimal guidance is essential.

title: Solution Architect
description: Valtech is an experience innovation company that partners with recognized brands and offers growth opportunities, a values-driven culture, and international careers.
The role of Solution Architect involves making the impact on customers measurable and working for leading brands in a challenging, international environment.
The Solution Architect will be an active member of client project teams, producing client solutions and developing skills while sharing knowledge with team members.
Responsibilities include leading a team on commerce technologies, providing enterprise solutions, analyzing business processes, and acting as a sales engineer for new and existing projects.
The position requires a focus on client success, strong client-facing skills, and a solid understanding of the project lifecycle and software development lifecycle.
A successful candidate will be adaptable, self-motivated, and take pride in delivering high-quality work in a fast-paced environment.
requirements: Candidates must have client-facing experience and the ability to communicate effectively, produce documentation, and lead client sessions.
The ability to sell technical concepts and the team's capabilities to business stakeholders is essential.
A strong technical architecture background is required, with expertise in Shopify and/or Adobe Commerce.
Nice to have qualifications include agency experience, knowledge of application lifecycle management/DevOps, and familiarity with ALM tools such as Jira and Git.
Knowledge of agile principles, TOGAF or other architectural frameworks, and experience integrating ERPs with commerce platforms are also beneficial.

title: Senior Design Systems Engineer (Remote Eligible)
description: Smartsheet is seeking a Senior Design Systems Engineer who will work remotely or from the Bellevue, WA office.
The role involves building and maintaining scalable, reusable UI components and patterns in alignment with design system guidelines and accessibility standards.
The engineer will collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate design specifications into robust, maintainable front-end code.
Responsibilities include supporting engineering teams by publishing and maintaining multiple code packages, documenting best practices, and enabling the adoption of system components.
The engineer will contribute to design system architecture decisions and code reviews, focusing on performance, accessibility, and API design.
The role requires partnering with designers to explore new interaction patterns and codifying them into reusable building blocks.
The engineer will develop internal tooling to streamline workflows for engineers and designers and create functional prototypes or proof-of-concepts as needed.
Advocacy for system adoption, consistent UI, and quality code through reviews, presentations, and collaboration is also a key responsibility.
requirements: Candidates must have 5+ years of experience as a front-end engineer, UI engineer, or design systems contributor.
Strong proficiency in modern JavaScript (ES6+), TypeScript, Node.js, React, and CSS is required.
Demonstrated experience in building and maintaining design systems or shared component libraries in production is essential.
A passion for creating systems that accelerate the work of engineers and designers is necessary.
Candidates should have a strong understanding of accessibility (WCAG), responsive design, and cross-browser compatibility.
Familiarity with automated testing for UI components (e.g., Jest, Testing Library, Storybook) is expected.
Excellent communication and documentation skills, especially when collaborating across disciplines, are required.
Bonus points for experience developing Figma plugins.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description: G-P is a leading SaaS-based Global Employment Platformâ„¢ that enables clients to expand into over 180 countries efficiently.
The company is dedicated to breaking down barriers to global business and creating opportunities for everyone.
G-P has diverse, remote-first teams that are essential to its success, fostering an environment where innovation thrives.
The Senior Full Stack Engineer will work across the entire stack, crafting React interfaces and architecting robust backend services.
Responsibilities include leading frontend development with React 18+ and TypeScript, building scalable backend services in Python and Go, and establishing CI/CD pipelines.
The role involves collaborating with product managers, UX designers, and AI/ML engineers, while mentoring mid-level engineers.
The position is unique as it involves joining a small, startup-structured team and building GIA from the ground up.
requirements: Candidates must have 6+ years of experience building web applications with solid frontend and backend experience.
Proficiency in React 18+ and the modern JavaScript/TypeScript ecosystem is required.
Strong Python skills and experience with AWS are essential.
Candidates should have designed APIs (REST and/or GraphQL) that are user-friendly for developers.
Hands-on experience with AWS services, Docker, and infrastructure as code is necessary.
Experience in building CI/CD pipelines and understanding observability is required.
Candidates should thrive in fast-paced, ambiguous environments and be highly independent and self-directed.

title: Senior Security Engineer (Presales) - Northwest region (San Francisco, CA)
description: GuidePoint Security is seeking a Senior Security Engineer (Presales) for the Northwest region, specifically in San Francisco, CA.
The role involves providing architectural guidance and product recommendations to customers, focusing on deploying and operationalizing cybersecurity solutions.
The position requires spending 100% of the time recommending technologies to address customer cybersecurity challenges.
The Senior Security Engineer will serve as the primary technical point of contact for clients throughout the project life cycle.
Responsibilities include designing, implementing, and operationalizing security controls across various IT and enterprise business systems.
The engineer must effectively communicate complex technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
The role requires the ability to prioritize and deliver on multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
The engineer will author comprehensive business and technical collateral tailored to both technical and managerial audiences.
Approximately 25% local travel in the Seattle area is required for customer/vendor meetings and events, with the remainder of the time working from home.
requirements: Candidates must have security engineering experience in the Information Security industry or as a technical lead for an internal Information Security program.
Experience with architecture, implementation, and troubleshooting of security technologies such as Network, Data Security, SIEM, and Endpoint is required.
Proficiency in multiple security technologies, including Next-Gen Firewalls, DLP, SASE, NAC, PAM, EDR, NDR, SIEM, APPSEC, CWPP, and CSPM is necessary.
A strong understanding of networking security concepts such as routing, segmentation, zones, and NAT is essential.
Deep proficiency in client and server operating systems, including Windows, Mac, and Linux, is required.
General networking and security troubleshooting skills, including firewalls, routing, and NAT, are necessary.
Candidates should possess scripting and development skills in BASH, Perl, Python, PowerShell, or Java, along with strong knowledge of regular expressions.
Experience with AWS, Azure, or GCP products and security best practices is required.
A working technical knowledge of advanced security concepts such as Defense in Depth and Zero Trust is necessary.
Experience in a consultative or professional services role is preferred.
Industry certifications from ISC2, SANS GIAC, or vendor certifications are preferred.

title: Site Reliability / Gitops Engineer
description: Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems, particularly known for its platform, Ubuntu, which is widely used in various enterprise initiatives.
The company supports a global workforce of over 1200 colleagues across 75+ countries, with minimal office-based roles and occasional in-person team meetings.
The Site Reliability / Gitops Engineer will join the Information Systems (IS) team, focusing on IT production services that support over 60 million Ubuntu users.
The role emphasizes operations automation in both private and public clouds, utilizing open source infrastructure as code software and CI/CD practices.
Responsibilities include defining infrastructure as code, improving Canonical products, providing feedback to developers, and collaborating with other teams.
The position is remote and available in any timezone.
requirements: Candidates must have deep experience in defining operations in code, utilizing version control, peer review, and CI/CD for application and infrastructure changes.
A strong modern engineering background, including peer-review, unit testing, SCM, CI/CD, and Agile methodologies, is required.
Python software development experience with large projects is essential.
Practical knowledge of Linux networking, routing, and firewalls is necessary.
Familiarity with various forms of Linux storage, such as Ceph and databases, is expected.
Hands-on experience administering enterprise Linux servers is required.
Extensive knowledge of cloud computing concepts and technologies is essential.
A Bachelor's degree or higher in computer science or a related engineering field is preferred.
Candidates must be able to communicate clearly and effectively in English across various platforms.
A motivated individual who can troubleshoot from kernel to web and is willing to seek help when needed is desired.
Flexibility and a quick learning ability are important traits for candidates.
Candidates should be inspired by the needs of fast-changing environments and be comfortable working within distributed teams.
A passion for and familiarity with open-source, particularly Ubuntu or Debian, is essential.

title: Senior Pre-Sales Solutions Engineer - EMEA
description: Deepgram is the leading voice AI platform for developers building speech-to-text (STT), text-to-speech (TTS), and full speech-to-speech (STS) offerings.
The company has over 200,000 developers using its voice-native foundational models, which are accessed through APIs or as self-managed software.

The position requires collaboration with strategic Account Executives throughout the customer journey, from discovery to production launch and expansion.
Responsibilities include leading technical discovery, designing and executing POCs, advising on architecture, running security and compliance threads, and creating reusable assets.
The role also involves enabling the field by collaborating with AEs, CSMs, and partners on demos and technical validation.
requirements: Candidates must have 5 or more years of experience in Solutions Engineering or a similar customer-facing technical role focused on pre-sales.
Professional software engineering experience in at least one language such as JavaScript/TypeScript, Python, or Rust is required.
Hands-on experience with modern cloud platforms, including Docker, Kubernetes, and secure API design, is necessary.
A proven track record of leading POCs for enterprise customers and achieving technical wins is essential.
Clear written and verbal communication skills across both technical and executive audiences are required.
Familiarity with procurement, InfoSec, and data privacy expectations across EMEA, including GDPR, is important.
Candidates should be based in an EMEA time zone with strong overlap to customer business hours and possess excellent English communication skills.

title: Sr. DevOps Engineer
description: Procurement Sciences AI (PSci.AI) is a Series A company focused on generative artificial intelligence in the government contracting sector.
The company is seeking a results-driven and innovative Sr. DevOps Engineer to build, maintain, and optimize their secure, multi-cloud AI-driven SaaS platform.
The role involves working closely with software engineering and SRE teams to deliver secure, reliable, automated cloud infrastructure and DevSecOps pipelines.
Key responsibilities include deploying and managing the SaaS platform across Azure, AWS, and Google Cloud Platform (GCP), ensuring high availability, security, scalability, and cost-effectiveness.
The engineer will design and maintain CI/CD pipelines, collaborate with development and security teams, manage multi-cloud virtual private networks, and implement monitoring and logging platforms.
The position requires ensuring compliance with security and auditability requirements, conducting vulnerability assessments, and providing technical guidance and production support.
The engineer will also be responsible for creating documentation and staying current with industry trends and best practices.
requirements: Candidates must have demonstrated success as a DevOps Engineer, Site Reliability Engineer, or Cloud Engineer in high-growth SaaS or cloud-native businesses.
Strong hands-on experience in deploying and supporting applications in Azure, AWS, and Google Cloud Platform environments is required.
Deep knowledge of containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and orchestration practices using tools like Helm is essential.
Proven ability to build and maintain CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, or similar tools is necessary.
Proficiency in scripting languages such as Bash and PowerShell is required; experience with Python or TypeScript is highly desirable.
Experience managing infrastructure as code (Terraform, ARM, Bicep) and automating cloud provisioning at scale is needed.
Familiarity with monitoring, logging, and observability platforms, as well as a strong understanding of SLIs, SLAs, and SLOs, is important.
A sound understanding of cloud security, networking fundamentals, and identity/access management in public and hybrid cloud architectures is required.
A Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience is necessary.
U.S. citizenship with the ability to pass a federal background check and identity verification is required.

title: Senior Devops Engineer
description: UR is a borderless smart money app that simplifies spending and off-ramping in one place.
The app is designed for both crypto natives and those curious about cryptocurrency.
UR aims to make the movement between digital assets and fiat currencies seamless and intuitive.
The position is for a Senior DevOps Engineer with responsibilities including managing production-level Kubernetes environments, troubleshooting, and optimizing systems.
requirements: Candidates must have 3 to 7 years of experience in DevOps/SRE, with at least 2 years of experience in production-level Kubernetes, including upgrades, troubleshooting, and optimization.
Proficiency in a mainstream CI/CD tool such as GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, or Jenkins is required.
Familiarity with Helm/Kustomize and container image optimization techniques, including multi-stage builds, SBOM, and image signing is necessary.
A solid understanding of Linux/network fundamentals, scripting (Bash), and proficiency in one backend programming language (either Go or Python) is essential.
Experience in blockchain node operations, including mainnet/testnet deployment, data directory and snapshots, upgrades and rollbacks, and monitoring and alerting is required.
Knowledge of Prometheus, Grafana, Alertmanager, and EFK/ELK/Loki, as well as an understanding of OTel, is necessary.
Strong security awareness is required, including secrets management, CVE governance, image and dependency scanning, and adherence to the principle of least privilege (RBAC).
Excellent communication and collaboration skills are essential, along with the ability to write Runbooks, Playbooks, change proposals, and post-mortem reports.

title: Senior Backend Developer, Payments
description: KOHO is on a mission to improve financial services for Canadians by eliminating hidden fees and predatory interest rates, focusing on products that help users spend smart, save more, and build wealth.
The company promotes a work culture that values work-life integration, offering flexible hours and a remote-first setup.
As a Senior Backend Developer on the Payments team, you will architect and build the financial infrastructure that processes millions of dollars daily.

Responsibilities include designing and operating high-throughput services for payment processing, evolving the integration layer with core banking platforms, and maintaining an immutable financial ledger service.
You will own the full lifecycle of your services, including technical design, implementation, monitoring, and participating in on-call rotations.
The role involves driving technical strategy, mentoring engineers, and collaborating with product managers and security teams to deliver compliant payment solutions.
requirements: Significant professional experience in backend development with a proven track record in designing and operating large-scale distributed systems.
Deep understanding of microservices architecture, including data consistency, fault tolerance, and inter-service communication.
Meticulous attention to quality, with experience in systems where correctness and reliability are critical.
Hands-on experience with core technologies such as Go and PostgreSQL, or proficiency in similar languages like Java or C#.
Solution-oriented mindset with a strong ability to take ownership of complex problems from discovery to resolution.
Excellent communication skills to articulate complex technical decisions and their business implications.
Practitioner's understanding of modern AI-first development, including AI-assisted coding and advanced prompt engineering.

title: Sr. Frontend Software Engineer

Responsibilities include building new features based on user requirements, collaborating with backend engineers and designers, and managing large-scale system deployments.
The engineer will also triage Cloud incidents, monitor errors, troubleshoot production issues, and participate in code reviews.
requirements: A Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science or a related technical field with at least 3 years of experience is required.
Candidates must have good knowledge of data structures and algorithms and proficiency in at least one programming language such as JavaScript, C, C++, Python, or Go.
Self-motivation and the ability to drive projects with mentorship and project requirements are essential.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, along with the ability to work effectively in teams, are necessary.
Candidates should be driven, excited about challenges in a fast-paced environment, and interested in building large-scale distributed systems.
Experience in building web applications, as well as proficiency in JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, React/Flux, and modern JavaScript tooling (Gulp/Grunt/Webpack/Babel) is required.
A strong foundation in algorithms and application design is also necessary.

title: Big Data Analyst
description: We are looking for a talented Data Analyst with a passion for managing, analyzing, and visualizing data to find actionable insights and help improve outcomes for our business and internal customers.
Responsibilities include deep-dive analysis of subscriber data from large databases.
The role involves writing and running SQL queries to retrieve data from databases.
You will be responsible for monitoring and auditing the accuracy and completeness of collected data.
Organizing data into usable formats is a key task.
You will generate information and insights from data and identify trends and patterns.
Conducting A/B tests to understand and evaluate the quality of data models is part of the job.
Creating data dashboards, graphs, and visualizations is expected.
You will also develop and maintain automated data processes.
requirements: Experience with SQL queries and data aggregation is required.
Proficiency in SQL / PLSQL programming is necessary.
An excellent knowledge of Excel and confidence in using it is essential.
Skills to optimize SQL queries are required.
Experience in developing analytical reports and interactive dashboards in Power BI is needed.
Financial and analytical data presentation skills are important.
The ability to gain knowledge from a large amount of data is necessary.
Basic knowledge of statistics is required.
Familiarity with Jira and Confluence is expected.
Experience in Machine Learning and Big Data technologies is a plus.

title: Senior DevSecOps Engineer

Raft is a customer-focused small business specializing in Distributed Data Systems, Platforms at Scale, and Complex Application Development, headquartered in Reston, VA.
The company supports federal and public agencies by leveraging design thinking, cutting-edge technology, and a cloud-native ecosystem to build impactful digital solutions.

Key responsibilities include developing Infrastructure as Code and Configuration as Code using GitCI, leveraging AWS cloud infrastructure, creating Helm charts for EKS, developing scripts in bash/Python/Perl/go, automating processes, integrating services with Kubernetes, and participating in daily scrum meetings and sprint planning.
requirements: Candidates should have 4-5+ years of industry experience, with 3-5 years specifically in Kubernetes and containerization tools like Docker.
Knowledge of Istio, Custom Kubernetes Operators, Custom Helm charts, and Custom Controllers is required.
A minimum of 2 years of experience in building and maintaining compliant computing environments in AWS or Azure using terraform/helm is necessary.
Proficiency in Golang for developing cloud-based solutions and basic programming languages like Python for scripting and debugging is essential.
Experience in building CI/CD pipelines and using configuration management tools such as Puppet, Chef, or Ansible is required.
Familiarity with DevSecOps tasks, debugging cluster-based computing architectures, and a Bachelorâ€™s degree in CS, CE, or a related field is mandatory.
Certifications such as Security+ or higher and Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) or Certified Kubernetes Application Developer (CKAD) are required.
Highly preferred qualifications include experience with DoDâ€™s Platform One, the ability to develop custom Kubernetes Operators, and a Certified AWS Solutions Architect credential.
Candidates must be able to maintain a Secret security clearance.

Responsibilities include proactively identifying performance issues, defining best-of-class architecture, mentoring teams, taking ownership of caching support with Redis, leading by example in code quality, and improving testing strategies.
The position is part of a fast-paced, flexible full stack team focused on developing impactful features for critical organizations.

Experience with AI-assisted development tools, such as Claude Code, is preferred.
A solid understanding of modern development workflows, including CI/CD, E2E testing, distributed systems, and cloud infrastructure is required.
Strong written and verbal communication skills suitable for diverse audiences are necessary.
Candidates must be capable of working independently across multiple time zones while engaging in team collaboration.

title: Junior Developer in QA
description: Veeam is a global leader in data resilience, providing solutions for data backup, recovery, portability, security, and intelligence.
The company is based in Seattle and serves over 550,000 customers worldwide.
The Quality Assurance Department is seeking a Junior Developer in QA to work in the Warsaw R&D office.
The role involves working with test-automation teams that utilize Python or C#.

Responsibilities include advancing skills in testing and development, developing and supporting automated tests for Veeam products, interacting with development participants, analyzing software requirements, building and maintaining testing infrastructure, and analyzing test results while maintaining a defects database.
requirements: Candidates should have a passion for working in IT with top technologies.
A fondness for programming is essential, with experience in writing scripts in Python or PowerShell, or developing applications in C/C++ or C#.
An interest in software testing is required.
Applicants should be open-minded, possess common sense and clear logic, and have a lively mind for analysis.
The ability to learn quickly and tackle exciting and non-standard tasks is important.
Fluency in English, both written and spoken, is mandatory.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Product)
description: Stora is on a mission to reinvent self-storage through technology, helping operators run their businesses more efficiently and unlock new revenue opportunities.
The company has assisted over 450 operators in processing tens of millions in automated payments and is recognized as an innovator in the self-storage space.
As a Senior Software Engineer, you will lead the design and development of complex features from concept to deployment.
You will collaborate with product and stakeholders to define scope, refine requirements, and ensure solutions meet business goals.

The role involves making architectural decisions to maintain the Rails app's performance and scalability, dedicating time to improve stability and developer experience, and maintaining a strong automated test suite.
You will proactively monitor and resolve production issues while mentoring and supporting other engineers through code reviews and knowledge sharing.
The technology stack includes Rails 7.1, PostgreSQL, Redis, Sidekiq, TimescaleDB, Turbo 8, React, Minitest, and GitHub Actions.
requirements: You must have a proven track record of designing, building, and scaling production Rails applications.
A strong command of Rails fundamentals, including ActiveRecord and background jobs, is essential.
Experience in architecting maintainable systems that balance speed of delivery with long-term sustainability is required.
You should be comfortable working across the stack, including frontend technologies like JavaScript and CSS.
Familiarity with modern LLM-powered tools to accelerate work and the judgment to know when to rely on your expertise is necessary.
A strong testing mindset with hands-on experience in Minitest or RSpec is expected.
You must be confident in debugging and resolving complex production issues.
The ability to mentor and support other engineers is crucial.
Clear communication skills to articulate technical challenges, trade-offs, and decisions are required.

title: Senior QA Automation Engineer (Game Client)
description: Playson is a leading iGaming supplier founded in 2012, recognized worldwide for providing a high-end micro-service-based platform that processes billions of financial transactions daily.
The Game Client team is seeking a Senior QA Automation Engineer who is passionate about delivering a flawless gaming experience.
The role involves working closely with developers to create automated tests for both functionality and performance of the new game client.
The goal is to ensure the client is stable, fast, and visually perfect across all devices and browsers.
requirements: Candidates must have 4+ years of experience in automation testing, both front-end and back-end.
Experience with Playwright is required.
A strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes is essential.
Knowledge of SQL and scripting is necessary.
Experience with Python, specifically pytest, requests, sqlalchemy, or similar, is required.
A good understanding of HTTP(s), XML, JSON, HTML, CSS, and JS is needed.
Experience working with Jira, Confluence, and Zephyr is required.
Proficiency with Git is necessary.
Candidates must have at least an upper-intermediate level of English.

title: Staff Software Engineer, Rust
description: Foxglove is a robotics observability and visualization platform that manages and provides access to large amounts of data across both hosted platforms and customer sites.
The company is seeking a highly skilled product and Rust focused Software Engineer with professional experience in delivering streaming and analytic workloads for robotics data.
The role involves designing and developing backend services, data processing pipelines, and interfaces.

Key challenges include ingesting massive volumes of sensor data through both batch and real-time offload, providing low-latency random-access playback over large volumes of data, managing multi-cloud architecture, offloading data from remote devices in network-constrained environments, and building systems to manage petabytes of multi-modal data reliably and efficiently.

The technical stack includes Rust and Typescript for ingestion, streaming, and other compute services, PostgreSQL, managed Kubernetes environments in GCP, customer deployments in Azure and AWS, and endpoint software on customer robots written in Rust.
The company operates remotely with staff in the U.S. and Australia, requiring candidates to be within 3 hours of Australian Eastern Time and able to overlap 3+ hours with Pacific Time Zone (US).
requirements: Candidates must have 6+ years of experience writing production software.
A minimum of 2+ years of professional experience using Rust is required.
Experience in writing highly performant and memory-efficient code is necessary.
Candidates should have experience with binary data serialization or network communication protocols.
Experience in shipping software in network-constrained environments is essential.
A passion for building technical tools with engineers as the primary users is expected.
Candidates must be comfortable participating in on-call rotations.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required.
The ability to thrive in a fast-paced, small team environment is necessary.

title: Senior Mobile Engineer (Flutter)
description: Moniepoint is an all-in-one financial services platform for emerging markets and the second-fastest growing company in Africa.
Since 2019, Moniepointâ€™s technology has powered over 3 million people, offering personal and business banking, payment, credit, and business management tools.
Moniepoint processed $182 billion in 2023 and currently processes the majority of the POS transactions in Nigeria.

The role also involves exploring feasible architectures for new features, resolving existing system problems, suggesting efficient data structures, following best practices, using CI/CD for deployment, documenting projects and code, managing code on Git, communicating project statuses, ensuring security guidelines are followed, validating cloud systems, maintaining software through its lifecycle, connecting with Quality Assurance, resolving bugs, performing profiling and assessments, executing app verification protocols, and writing tests for the app.

Proficiency in Flutter for building cross-platform mobile apps for Android, iOS, and web, including responsive UIs and optimized state management.
Experience with native Android and iOS for building custom Flutter packages is required.
Familiarity with Firebase, including Cloud Firestore, Push Notifications, Cloud Functions, and Analytics is necessary.
Knowledge of Figma for analyzing and viewing designs is essential.
Proficiency in Git for project management and collaboration is required.
Candidates must be able to provide a portfolio showing projects solely worked on upon request.
A Bachelor's Degree in a related field is required.
Nice to have experience with technologies such as Angular, Bootstrap, JavaScript, Native Android, and Dart.

title: Senior Software Engineer Specialist
description: The position is for a Senior Software Engineer with a focus on scalable backend systems in production environments.
Candidates should have 6+ years of experience in this field.
Strong programming skills in Python and JavaScript are required, with an emphasis on writing clean, maintainable code for both backend and React-based front-end components.
Experience in deploying and maintaining containerized applications using Kubernetes and Docker is preferred.
Proficiency in designing and consuming REST APIs and working with frameworks like FastAPI is necessary.
An understanding of microservices and event-driven architecture patterns is essential.
Familiarity with distributed systems and modern Git-based workflows is expected.

Responsibilities include developing performant APIs and backend services using Python and FastAPI, and integrating features into React-based front ends.
The engineer will contribute to the design of microservice-based, event-driven architectures for seamless system integrations and scalable product growth.
The project aims to deliver reliable infrastructure and performant backend capabilities.
requirements: Candidates must have 6+ years of experience in scalable backend systems in production environments.
Strong programming skills in Python and JavaScript are required, with the ability to write clean, maintainable code.
Experience in deploying and maintaining containerized applications using Kubernetes and Docker is preferred.
Proficiency in designing and consuming REST APIs and working with frameworks like FastAPI is necessary.
An understanding of microservices and event-driven architecture patterns is essential.
Familiarity with distributed systems and modern Git-based workflows is expected.
Experience working on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is preferred.
All candidates must pass an interview as part of the contracting process.

title: Data Engineer
description: Valtech is an experience innovation company that partners with recognized brands and offers growth opportunities, a values-driven culture, and international careers.
The environment at Valtech is designed for continuous learning, meaningful impact, and professional growth.
The role of Data Engineer requires candidates to have strong quantitative backgrounds and analytical discipline.
